Posts.Content: Faye100 wrote: I am scheduled to see a surgeon May 6.  I have a painful, swollen, three mass, bloody discharging breast.  It is painful.  I have been looked at by my ob/gyn and he sent me to a general surgeon that turned into a not so great experience and no answers and a cavalier approach as to the appointments for the next doctor.  Their conclusion "it could be nothing or it could really be bad."  I don't feel good about this and with the advent of the bloody discharge which occurred after I saw the last doctor, i feel like it is bad.  Anyway, I fired that surgeon and chose an oncological surgeon at a larger hospital to look at it, hence the May 6 appointment.  Any suggestions for pain and swelling in the mean time?   Needless to say, I am tired, stressed and hurting.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Not diagnosed yet Faye100 Faye100

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2014 01:02PM Faye100 wrote: I have had an ultrasound.  That is all.  One reason I fired the surgeon and went elsewhere is that after two doctor visits very little was actually done.  The ultrasound shows three masses.  Two look basically like cysts but there are some solids in it.  The other is mostly solid.  It started about 4 months ago. I tend to have cysts and I don't usually go in right away.  Usually, they clear up on their own.  I also went from a $500 deductible to $3000. I was not at all prepared for that.   I don't have $3000 and that is what this will cost.  At least.  A friend is going to help me with that.  I hate that a lot but I have to do what I have to do. I didn't have enough time between finding out (Dec. 1) and getting a problem to get up $3000.  I went in April 18.   I just didn't get the help that i needed. I also have several close friends who have had their cancer missed from this same system.  This was different for me therefore, I decided to go to a larger system and a renowned doctor to deal with this.   Celine, thanks for the advice.  I have tried a heating pad and ice pack.  I have not tried wet compresses though.  Heat does better than ice.  As for pot, it is illegal in our state and am afraid of trying that although, I wish I could.
Posts.Title: Not diagnosed yet Faye100 Faye100
